---
## Functionnal programming

* Never use `for` loops.

--

<br>

* Forget all `*apply()` functions and friends

  * `mapply()`, `tapply()`, `lapply()`, `mapply()`, ...
  
  * `Map()`, `Reduce()`
  
  * `Vectorize()`

--

<br>

* Embrace `map*()` functions and friends

  * `map()`, `map_dbl()`, `map_chr()`, `map_lgl()`, ...
  
  * `map2()`, `map2_dbl()`, `map2_chr()`, `map2_lgl()`, ...
  
  * `pmap()`, `pmap_dbl()`, `pmap_chr()`, `pmap_lgl()`, ...
  
  * `walk()`, `walk2()`, `pwalk()`, ...

---
## `map*()`


<center>
  <img src="img/map.png", width=400> 
</center>

--

* `map()` applies the function to each element and returns a list.

--

* `map_lgl()`, `map_int()`, `map_dbl()` and `map_chr()` applies the function to each element and returns a atomic vector of the corresponding type.


---
## `map*()`

```{r echo=FALSE}
set.seed(42)
```


```{r}
map(1:100, rnorm)
```

`map2()` and `map2_*()` are variants of `map()` and `map_*()` which work with two arguments.

## `pmap*()`


<center>
  <img src="img/pmap-3.png", width=400> 
</center>


`pmap()` and `pmap_*()` are generalized versions of `map()` and `map_*()` which work with any number of arguments.

---
## `pmap*()`


```{r}
pmap(list(n = c(2, 3, 2, 5), min = 1:4, max = c(2, 5, 5, 10)), runif)
```

---
## `*walk*()` functions 

`walk()` and variant are designed for side-effects function and return the input.

```{r}
list(iris, mtcars) %>% 
  walk(~ print(nrow(.))) %>% 
  str()
```


---
## `reduce()`


<center>
  <img src="img/reduce.png", width=400> 
</center>

`reduce(list(x1, x2, x3), f)` is equivalent to `f(f(x1, x2), x3)`

## A little function

```{r divisors}
divisors <- function(N){
  if(N == 1) {return(1)}
  if(N == 2) {return(1:2)}
  vec <- c()
  for (i in 2:(N/2)){
    if (N %% i == 0) {
      vec <- c(vec, i)
    }
  }
  return(c(1, vec, N))
}
```


```{r}
map(4:6, divisors)
```

---
## Dataset

```{r datapins, message=FALSE}
df_pins <- read_table2("PINS.DON", 
                       col_names = c("variete", "diametre", "hauteur"))
df_pins
```


---
## Classical output of linear regression

```{r}
reg_simple <- lm(hauteur ~ diametre * variete, data = df_pins)
reg_simple
```

---
count:false
## Classical output of linear regression

```{r}
reg_simple <- lm(hauteur ~ diametre * variete, data = df_pins)
summary(reg_simple)
```

---
count:false
## Classical output of linear regression

```{r}
reg_simple <- lm(hauteur ~ diametre * variete, data = df_pins)
coef(summary(reg_simple))
coef(reg_simple)
```

---
## `tidy()`

Presents the outputs of the model in a tibble.

```{r}
tidy(reg_simple)
```

---
## `glance()` 

Returns summary informations about the model in a singe row tibble.

```{r}
glance(reg_simple)
```

---
## `augment()` 

Adds information about each observation in the dataset.

```{r}
(augmented <- augment(reg_simple, df_pins))
```

---
## Graph of residuals

```{r resid, fig.height=5}
ggplot(augmented) +
  aes(x = .fitted, y = .resid, color = variete) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(color = "black", method = "loess", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Fitted values", y = "Residuals")
```

---
## Quantile-quantile plot

```{r qq, fig.height=5}
ggplot(augmented) +
  aes(sample = .resid) +
  geom_qq_line(color = "red") +
  geom_qq()+
  labs(x = "Theoretical quantiles", y = "Standardized residuals")
```

---
## Leverage

```{r cook, fig.height=5}
ggplot(augmented) +
  aes(x = .hat, y = .std.resid, color = variete) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, alpha = 0.5, linetype = "dashed") +
  geom_hline(yintercept = 0, alpha = 0.5, linetype = "dashed") +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(color = "black", method = "loess", se = FALSE) +
  labs(x = "Leverage", y = "Standardized residuals")
```

---
## Cook's distances

```{r, fig.height=5}
augmented %>% 
  rowid_to_column("ID") %>% 
  ggplot() +
  aes(x = ID, y = .cooksd, fill = variete) +
  geom_col(color = "grey30") +
  labs(x = "Observation", y = "Cook's Distance")
```

---
## Wilcoxon test

```{r, wilcox, warning=FALSE}
w_test <- wilcox.test(hauteur ~ variete, data = df_pins)
w_test
```

--

<br>

```{r}
tidy(w_test)
```

## Estimation of parameters

```{r}
bootstrap_pins <-
  df_pins %>% 
  rowid_to_column("ID") %>% 
  mutate(diametre2 = diametre^2) %>% 
  bootstraps(times = 50)
bootstrap_pins
```

---
## `rsplit` object

```{r}
bootstrap_pins %>% 
  pull(splits) %>% 
  first()
```

---
count:false
## `rsplit` object

```{r}
bootstrap_pins %>% 
  pull(splits) %>% 
  first() %>% 
  as_tibble() 
```

---
## Analysis & assessment sets

```{r}
bootstrap_pins %>% 
  pull(splits) %>% 
  first() %>% 
  as_tibble() %>% # analysis()
  pull(ID) %>% 
  table()
```

--

```{r}
bootstrap_pins %>% 
  pull(splits) %>% 
  first() %>% 
  as_tibble(data = "assessment") %>% # assessment()
  pull(ID) %>% 
  table()
```

---
## Bootsrtaped models

```{r}
my_lm <- partial(lm, formula = hauteur ~ (diametre + diametre2) * variete)
```

--

```{r}
bootstrap_pins <-
  bootstrap_pins %>% 
  mutate(reg = map(splits, my_lm))
bootstrap_pins
```
